Class Project

java.lang.Object
Project
public class Project extends Object
Project Class The class is used manage project information Each parameter of the project class stores an array to allow for project details New entries are appended to the end of each array at the last index value Each project is automatically assigned as false for for finalized Similarly each project is assigned a completions date after being completed
Version:
3.00, 01 September 2021
Author:
Chris Joubert

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Project​(int newProjectNum, String newBuildingType, int newERFNum, String street, String city, String region, String country, String postalCode, BigDecimal newTotalCost, BigDecimal newTotalPaid, String newDeadLine, String newProjectName)
    Person Class Initialization Method
    The method sets the initial values for the person class Account number is initialized a 1 and cannot be changed by the end user If initial account values are unknown this should be initialized as "none"

  • Constructor Details

    • Project

      public Project​(int newProjectNum, String newBuildingType, int newERFNum, String street, String city, String region, String country, String postalCode, BigDecimal newTotalCost, BigDecimal newTotalPaid, String newDeadLine, String newProjectName)
      Person Class Initialization Method
      The method sets the initial values for the person class Account number is initialized a 1 and cannot be changed by the end user If initial account values are unknown this should be initialized as "none"
      Parameters:
      newProjectNum - int contains the project number for the starting value
      newBuildingType - String contains the building type for the starting value
      newERFNum - int contains the ERF number for the starting value
      street - String contains the street for the starting value
      city - String contains the city for the starting value
      region - String contains the province for the starting value
      country - String contains the country for the starting value
      postalCode - String contains the postal code for the starting value
      newTotalCost - BigDecimal contains the Total Cost for the starting value
      newTotalPaid - BigDecimal contains the Total Paid for the starting value
      newDeadLine - String contains the Due Date for the starting value
      newProjectName - String contains the project name for the starting value
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      setNewProject(java.sql.Statement,int,int,int,int,java.lang.String)

  • Method Details

    • editProject

      public void editProject​(int projectIndex)
      Edit Project Method
      Method used to edit current projects values The method selects a project based on the passed index number and then allows the user to edit a selected parameter of that project If no project current exists the user is asked to first create a project
      Parameters:
      projectIndex - int contains the index number of the project to be edited
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • checkInvoice

      public int checkInvoice()
      Check Invoice Method
      Checks if an invoice needs to be created by returning the value of of the "invoiceToCreate" parameter -1 indicates no invoices should be created >= 0 indicate the index number of the account that needs an invoice
      Returns:
      invoiceToCreate int, contains the index of the project that needs an invoice generated
      Since:
      version 2.00
      See Also:
      editProject(int)

    • resetInvoice

      public void resetInvoice()
      Reset Invoice Method
      Resets the invoiceToCreate parameter to avoid having further invoices generated
      Since:
      version 2.00
      See Also:
      editProject(int)

    • editPersonnelChecker

      public boolean editPersonnelChecker()
      Edit Personnel Checker Method
      Returns true if personToChange's index 0 is set to "> 0" this indicates personel on an account needs to be changed
      Returns:
      true/false boolean - true indicates personel needs to be changed
      Since:
      version 2.00
      See Also:
      editProject(int)

    • resetPeronnelEdit

      public void resetPeronnelEdit()
      Reset Personnel Edit Method
      Resets personnelToChange to indicate no further personnel accounts need to be changed or edited
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • toString

      public String toString​(int index)
      To String Method
      Returns a string of the project's parameters in a single formatted string
      Parameters:
      index - int, contains the index of the project to be displayed in the invoice
      Returns:
      output String, contains the project's parameters
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      setNewProject(java.sql.Statement,int,int,int,int,java.lang.String)

    • toInvoice

      public String toInvoice​(Statement statement, int index) throws SQLException
      To Invoice Method
      Returns all the project's details in one formatted string to display on screen and save to txt files
      Parameters:
      statement - Statement used to query the SQL sever to locate the customers contact details
      index - int, contains the index of the project to be displayed in the invoice
      Returns:
      output String, contains the project's parameters formatted as an invoice
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error is encountered with SQL queries
      Since:
      version 3.00

    • getSavedData

      public void getSavedData​(String savedData)
      Get Saved Data Method
      Used to set the parameters of the projects based on the passed string from a saved file
      Parameters:
      savedData - String, contains the data to be assigned to each of the parameters for the projects that were saved
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • getAllData

      public String[] getAllData​(int projectIndex)
      Get All Data Method
      Stores all data from a project in a single array
      Parameters:
      projectIndex - int used to select the project to return all the values from
      Returns:
      allDataToReturn String, contains all the current data from every project parameter
      Since:
      version 3.00

    • getUnfinishedProjects

      public int getUnfinishedProjects()
      Get Unfinished Projects Method
      Creates a selection menu displaying all unfinished projects If no unfinished projects are found an error is displayed
      Returns:
      searchIndex int, contains index number of selected project / -1 of input is canceled
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • getAccountListValues

      public String[] getAccountListValues()
      Get Account List Values Method
      Creates an array list containing details for accounts to be displayed in dropdown selections
      Returns:
      newValueList String, contains array with values for drop down box selections
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • getAccountNumProjects

      public int getAccountNumProjects​(int accountNum, String personName)
      Get Account Num Projects Method
      Searches existing projects for a personnel account that matches the passed parameters Requests the user to selected an associated project If the person is not associated with a project, the method returns -1
      Parameters:
      accountNum - int, contains account number of the person to search for as associated with the accounts
      personName - String, contains person's name to be displayed if no associated projects are located
      Returns:
      searchIndex String, contains the index of the project associated with the person that was selected
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • getOverDueSelection

      public int getOverDueSelection()
      Get Over Due Selection Method
      Searches existing projects for projects that are currently overdue Requests the user to select an overdue project from the list If no overdue projects are found or the user cancels, the method returns -1
      Returns:
      searchIndex String, contains the index value of the selected overdue project
      Since:
      version 2.00

    • setNewProject

      public int setNewProject​(Statement statement, int manaAccnum, int archAccNum, int contAccNum, int custAccNum, String custLastName) throws SQLException
      Set New Project Method
      Used to create a new project Requests the user to enter the values for each parameter Each parameter is then appended to the arrays after all have been entered
      Parameters:
      statement - Statement used to confirm the selected account number is not in use and determine project index
      manaAccNum - int contains Manager account number to be assigned to the project
      archAccNum - int contains Architect account number to be assigned to the project
      contAccNum - int contains Engineer account number to be assigned to the project
      custAccNum - int contains Customer account number to be assigned to the project
      custLastName - String contains the current surname of the client
      Returns:
      int Account index values containing the index of the new account
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error is encountered with SQL queries
      Since:
      version 3.00
